TopicTitle: When Commands are Missing from a Part's Right-Click Menu

Articles.Content:
Not sure if this is in the right place, because it's not a support request per se--but if anyone else has seen the following problem, I've got a workaround at the end of the post.

A while back, I put a space station in orbit around the Mun. It has six extended communications antennas on it, arranged in a circle to look like a beam weapon (my game is titled "The Galactic Empire" complete with Imperial flag.....)

Recently I noticed that one of the antennae was closed. No idea how that happened, because I didn't close it. When I right-clicked and tried to open the antenna, the "Extend Antenna" option wasn't there!

After a lot of exiting and reloading and general head-bashing, I went into the gamesave file (persistent.sfs) with Wordpad, looked in the station's part list, and compared the six antennas against each other, looking for one that was different. The first one did indeed have something wierd: in the first MODULE/EVENT/Toggle subsection, the "active" flag was set to FALSE, whereas the other five antennas had TRUE. I closed KSP, changed "false" to "true", saved the change to persistent.sfs., reloaded the game, and when I went back to the space station and right-clicked the screwy antenna, its right-click menu was working normally again.

I've got no idea how that one antenna got out of whack, but if you see this and you're okay with messing around in the save file (make a backup first!) this is how you can fix a part whose right-click menu went AWOL.
